channel.title: What the hell
channel.description:
Starting my server?server Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2 " at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:2460) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:29) at server.main(server.java:30)
i do not get this any ideas o.O

item.title: What the hell
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You could always Google the problem you’re having (well, the exception you’re getting.) It works 100% of the time.

But for your case, you can see that the loadAutoSpawn() method was declared. Obviously, this checked your npc.cfg (or similar) file to load where the NPC’s spawn on startup. Accidentally, while editing the file, you most likely hit the spacebar after a number. When (by looking at your error) NumberFormatException is thrown, that means the system could not generate an integer out of the String given. The string was "2 ", and as you can see, the spacebar made it an invalid integer. Therefore, the exception was thrown.

How to fix it? Just remove the space after the 2.

I really hope you fully understand this post, because it’s here to teach you.

Read full topic

item.title: What the hell
item.dc:creator: @Evan1 Evan`
item.description:
@Evan1 wrote:

You spaced in a.cfg file use TAB.

Read full topic

item.title: What the hell
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

Have you changed the code of any of the java files since u got that error? if so then undo those changes because you may have changed something that causes that error. it looks from
at NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:2460)
at NPCHandler.(NPCHandler.java:29)
at server.main(server.java:30)
That your problem sits in either NPCHandler.java or server.java files but it might not be, it may be an error in another file that links to those files. hope this helps.

Read full topic
